description: Served as the Batte Management Command, Control, Computers, Communications, and Intelligence (BMC4I) Officer in Charge for an Army Air and Missile Defense Command level equivalent unit. Deployed to Israel for 13 months to support the deployment, installation, and integration of a forward-based Air and Missile Defense radar. While deployed, I was the U.S. Joint Interface Control Officer (JICO) lead to integrate U.S. Army, Navy, and Air Force assets within the area and during deployments and exercises to create a common tactical picture for the U.S. European Command (USEUCOM) leadership back in Stuttgart, Germany. During my deployment, I was awarded the Israeli Air Force's Air Defense Officer medal which has been authorized for permanent wear on my Army Service Uniform. Upon redeployment, I was reassigned within the hedquarters to serve as the 357th AMD-D's S6 Officer in Charge for four (4) months to cover a gap of communication officers that could perform the job. description: Battalion S2 for a Brigade Support Battalion (BSB) consisting of 867 Soldiers providing Combat Service Support to an Infantry Brigade Combat Team deployed in Regional Command-East. Prepared all intelligence-related products, to include Daily Updates, Weekly Intelligence Rollups, CONOP Briefings, Be-On-The-Lookout Reports, etc. Disseminated all time-sensitive threat reporting to company elements and coordinated all collection efforts (conventional and unconventional) in support of BSB's Force Protection mission of FOB Fenty: a joint and multinational airfield with over 2,300 tenants.

description: Brigade Special Troops Battalion S2 OIC responsible for providing timely, relevant and accurate intelligence support covering over 550 kilometers of Afghan-Pakistan border spanning three Provinces and two Brigade AORs to Battalion-level leaders and staff. Conducted close partnership and daily shared intelligence processes with 2nd Zone Afghan Border Police (ABP) S2 elements; trained and mentored ABP intelligence personnel at all echelons in 7 Kandaks through bimonthly Intelligence Courses, quarterly Conferences and Staff Assistance Visits. Maintained detailed knowledge of corruption throughout 2nd Zone, resulting in the removal of 5 corrupt Kandak Commanders. Enabled physical security of partnered mission through badge issuing and biometrics processing. Managed 12 local national interpreters.
